Reviews.Title: “Small, cheap, and centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: Toan N
Reviews.Content: Ibis is an excellent choice for bargain travelers. My colleague and I stayed in a very small room with two twin beds for $102 USD. That's $51 per person. Do not expect a fancy hotel. This hotel does the bare minimum and that's just fine with me. Dubai can get expensive so I don't mind paying fifty bucks for a hotel room. Bring your own toiletries if you don't care for the hotel shampoo. It smells like cleaning soap as opposed to actual shampoo. The hotel is centrally located and taxis are in abundance outside the front door. Sublime is a bar in the back of the hotel. It sells alcohol. The servers at Sublime were not friendly at all. They were miserable and barely smiled. However, the hotel staff was consistently nice. Free wifi in the hotel lobby. Stay at Ibis if you want be centrally located and don't mind a tiny room to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and short time”
Reviews.Author: alhattalith1
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 nights, 5 days at this hotel for second time, it was nice and close to the world trade center, I thing only need to renew the room facility, but I really enjoined staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Average Value, Old DIY Property”
Reviews.Author: Aneesh2011
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps one of Ibis' very old properties in the region. The rooms don't even have a minibar fridge even and the standard answer is "it is going to be upgraded soon, this year." Its a DIY property - where everything is on self service mode - provided it works! The only reason to stay there would be the proximity to the Convention Center - where most trade shows are held. But the price fluctuates sharply based on events being held. Staff are a bit arrogant since they know that guests would not have much choice in the vicinity of the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ha A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ibis WTC last December during an exhibitionat world trade centre which is next door. It was ideal location and rooms were ok. Free wifi in lobby, Only down side in this hotel I had to take my luggages upstairs myself!. apart from this all was ok and staff were friendly. I have not tried theire Restaurant as there are few cafes and restaurants just outside the hotel and I always had my brekfast at nero which was opposite the hotel. Good value for money and excellent location for business.

Reviews.Title: “Just somewhere to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: possiblebliss
Reviews.Content: a minimal but functional place to stay.. its a sort of diy hotel. You take your own luggage up, you park your own car and the parking block is a distance away but if your looking for somwehere cheap to stay and are planning on being out and about all day then this a good place to just sleep in. You have to leave a deposit for parking your car. there are vending machines for water, and the amenities in the room are minimal. The location is good being very close to the metro and a 5 min cab ride from Dubai Mall

Reviews.Title: “For short trip.”
Reviews.Author: alhattalith1
Reviews.Content: It's cute and nice hotel, for short trip or official without children be better.

Reviews.Title: “excellent if your main business is at the Dubai World Trade Center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location for exhibitors / visitors at/to the Dubai World Trade Center if your visit is for a beach, to visit the city center, whatnot - stay where you want to be - if price is an issue - ibis has various locations in dubai rooms: small but clean - typically ibis - it has everything you need but no extras plus in this ibis: there is actually space to hang your clothes and to place smaller clothing items in a cubboard the hotel bar is good - also good food (our indian colleagues pronounced the Indian buffet at lunch to be very GOOD! connected to the novotel WTC by walking through the congress center - Novotel has an excellent multi-cultural buffet in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, minimal service”
Reviews.Author: NG42
Reviews.Content: The hotel has small rooms but functional and i think worth the price. I had a short stay here and found a few very weird things: 1. There is no bell desk or person to help you with your luggage. 2. You have to leave a deposit with reception if you want to use the phone in your room, even for local calls. 3. The hotel will not take the responsibility of arranging a taxi for you All in all the hotel seems to follow the policy of having the bare minimum level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bismoy
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, near to the metro station. Very clean and crisp.Great massage parlor.Very courteous staff. Free wi-fi in the lobby was very fast.Absolutely loved the hotel.Will definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Stay In Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideally located, However the rooms definitely need to be refurbished. The Hotel is good value for money. The metro station is ideally located and is an absolute blessing if you do not have transport. if you have a car the parking is a bit far in WTC parking area.

Reviews.Title: “Near WTC”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fab location! The metro is just metres away. The restaurant food was impressive too. Definitely great value for money. The bathroom was considerably larger than the traditional IBIS hotels - maybe because of its location being in the WTC area?! I'll be staying here again....soon! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Manwooloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel. Check-in was good and the staff friendly. I always ask for a quiet room you guess why. My room was without surprise, that s why i choose Ibis : clean, not outdated ... The issue was during the night because of the disco near the hotel and from the car park. My room was located at the 8 floor, but we can clearly heard the noise. I have asked to change the room but it wasn't possible without paying more. The second issue, the shower gel recipient was empty the second day. For leisure the main interest of this hotel is the dubai metro that is at 3 minutes from the hotel. I would not come back because I already find better. Regards

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There is a very nice bar in the lobby. very nice live music and beverage.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we were very satisfied with our stay. clean tidy and curtious very good reception , this hotel is a good location . It was very good value for money and the only concern was the shower adjustment in the room which was either cold or scalding hot . Breakrast was very good indeed

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: You can take a metro directly from the airport to hotel and walk 11/2 block. Restaurants available and Wi-Fi free in lobby was a plus. Hotel bathroom felt like a motel and could get an upgrade from plastic cups to real glasses. Towels were thin and could also be upgraded. Hotel staff were pleasant and informative.

Reviews.Title: “View on the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As said repeatedly in the past, this will be best business hotel if it will allow free access to internet in guest's rooms rather having to go down to the Ground Floor to the lobby in order to get online free of charges, which definitely create some degree of difficulties for busy man like myself. Plesse take this comment constructively.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room is a bit small but if you are not fuzz about accommodation like I am then it's perfect. It's a good value for an international branded hotel and cheerful. The only problem is the water in the shower. It's not very stable. It's hot and cold within seconds but it doesnt stay that way for long. Free wifi in the lobby and a good night club right down stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: iforres
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated next to the Trade centre so if you are attending an event there, excellent location. If not then it is a bit isolated but taxis are cheap to get around in. Upon arrival the receptionist advised me that the room I had booked was not available and tried to fob me off with a smoking twin room rather than the double non smoking I had booked. Stood my ground and then suddenly i got the room I had booked despite the hotel being full. Not a good impression. Room is adequate and had everything I required for the 3 night stay. Had a meal in the restaurant which was nice. WiFi in lobby was free but a little slow at times. Breakfast was ok for me others may find it a bit limited. had to get room key revalidated on the 2nd day, but apart from that it is what you expect from an Ibis hotel. For this occasion of just needing a bed to crash out on it was fine. Good value though.

Reviews.Title: “no bathtub”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was good except no bathtub, no hair dryer, no electic kettle, no refrigerator. The best thing was the location for the exhibitors. It was like a oasis for the exhibitors who are really exhausted. Exhibitors could save time and taxi fee. : )

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ashisdutta
Reviews.Content: If you can forgo some luxuries like room service, it is a super value for money hotel to stay. The location is great with the metro rail station just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional.”
Reviews.Author: Wheretonext76
Reviews.Content: No complaints with this hotel. It is 2 minute walk from the WTC Metro station, reasonably priced taxis are often waiting outside and has a selection of cafes and restaurants even closer including a cafe Nero and Pizza Express. Hotel lobby area is pleasant with plenty of comfortable seating and free wi-fi. Bar and restaurant areas are also nicely finished. Hallways and rooms however don't share the same contemporary decor. Dark wood and sparse detailing in the room make for a space devoid of any personality, but service was very good, shower was powerful, there was a selection of tv channels and air conditioning was good and reasonably quiet. No tea/coffee facilities in the room, but chilled bottled water is very reasonable at 1d (around 20p). A good base.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bluealistair
Reviews.Content: two main reasons why i booked this hotel are 1. Location (near Dubai Mall) - very convenient and easy to locate 2. their website mentioned that they provide a parking space for their guests - however, when we arrived at 9 in the evening, the parking area around the hotel cannot be used due to an event, there was no one at the lobby who can tell us where to park so I went to the reception, wherein we were instructed to park our car at the other side of the road of Novotel... ( Novotel is at the back of IBIS).. we know that Dubai is a safe place, however, the parking area they were referring to is way too far... it was summer that time, so imagine the distance + heat in the afternoon... i complained (if there was an event that they are aware of which results to the inconvenience of people who need to park at the vicinity of their hotel they should have included a disclaimer on their website, mentioning the dates of unavailability of their facilities, etc) and was about to cancel my reservation right then and there as they were insisting for us to take the parking they were referring to.. to avoid this.... the manager said he can arrange for us to park at Novotel and so we parked at Novotel. still not that convenient but at least we felt more safe there. Our room was ok, very basic but clean there were no safety deposit box, but i think you can inquire from the reception if you have something to safekeep. I believe each floor has got a vendo machine for water/soda/snacks which is convenient if you forgot to buy water at the grocery. at the price we paid, it was nice to have breakfast for 2.... if you will not be staying in the hotel the whole day or most of your time while you're in Dubai... this hotel is relatively ok. it will be best to book online as it is much cheaper than walk-in booking... =)

Reviews.Title: “Ibis WTC Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was there in connection with the IBA Conference. PLUS: 1. The overriding plus was the location in the WTC. That is invaluable when attending a conference there. 2. The staff were very friendly and helpful 3. The hotel is basic but adequate (but see below). The room was clean and well serviced. The lifts were speedy. 4. The value/cost ratio is very high. MINUS 1. The room did not have a safe. I feel that that is an essential requirement for a business traveller. 2. The room did not have shelves for shirts, shorts, socks etc. An inconvenience 3. Wifi should be complimentary. If not, one should at least be able to log in with all devices (laptop, phone, tablet, etc.) not just one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the IBIS World Trade Center Location just before Christmas last year (2010) for about 6 months due to working out there. There was no pool or gym but the Novotel which was a 5 minute walk had a lovely pool and gym area which was a small charge. The IBIS itself was nice. It wasnt your 5 star Atlantis or Burj Al Arab but for what you pay its great value for money. It has the basics, bed, bathroom, tv etc. and I had breakfast included. I wasnt paying for the hotel but I looked online and it was pretty cheap. However, it didnt come across cheap. Staff were very helpful, room was always clean and bed was comfty. Breakfast was surprisingly really nice. Bar downstairs was good and had TVs there for watching sport. Free WIFI in reception aswell or they charge you in the room but theres loads of seating areas to sit and use Laptops etc. in reception area. Great location if your working in the Exhibition Center or anywhere in the DIFC area. DIFC is one or two stops on the Metro (very cheap and the stop is a 30 second walk) and Exhibition Center is on your door step. Not sure if I would stay here for a holiday but if your looking for the basics at a good price then this hotel is great. The only con is that it had no pool but the Novotel was very close so was able to use that. Overall, to be honest, a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the World Trade Centre, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birotteau
Reviews.Content: PROS: Value for money, good location (if you are attending meetings at the WTC), well laid out, free internet in the lobby, good coffee, good breakfast. CONS: small room, no fridge, no safety deposit box, no drawers, small hanging space, fixed windows, only 1 nightstand, very expensive (US$27 per day) internet (slow connection). In my case, the reception asked me at different times for my passport to photocopy (2 times), my credit card for miscellaneous charges (2 times), and papers to sign (also 2 times). They refused to allow me to charge breakfast to my room, and subsequently accepted when I pointed out there were already 3 other charges to my room. Very inconsistent service. CONCLUSION: if you came to work, and your work will be located at the adjoining WTC, this is a good place. Otherwise, seek a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eagle999
Reviews.Content: Reasonbly priced good location hotel. But the decor is not very nice. All modern plasticy and very small room. Shampoo and soap in a dispenser. Strange room service. You can orer by phone but have to go to the lobby to collect it. Don't think I would stay there again. Check out slow. Very basic. Actually reminds me of a cheap room in a Manila short time hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exhibition Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: got to say everything about the hotel are great specially if you are coming to Dubai for an exhibition. my negative point is that the rooms to have a small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and smelly”
Reviews.Author: carolinerevell
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here as the Novatel was full. The rooms reeked of smoke even though we had booked a non smoking room and 6th floor windows obviously do not open. Very basic bedrooms but in their defence the restaurant and lobby were clean and tidy and the staff were very pleasant. Good location for exhibitions in trade centre, in fact you are in the halls. Hotel at the other end of the halls superior and will always be a first choice over this one.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at IBIS Dubai World Trade Center”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had and excellent experience at this hotel as always. Room and services were excellent though would be nice if they had a gym facility but that is not a downside. Staff was always helpful and now the hotel is very close to the Dubai rail system.

Reviews.Title: “basic services but good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is a very clean hotel but dont have much services, even you have to take your luggage yourself to your room, no bellboy available , very basic facilities but still location is good if you have to attend a trade show which is organised in world trade center because its very near from there. otherwise there are several hotels available in city which provide lot better serivce at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business or explore Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Fungshuiboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Ibis for 3 nights.Good value for money 250 Aed per night.Free wireless Internet in lobby.Access cold from reception desk when you check-in. The breakfast for 55Aed was not that great value. Overall great location Dubai trade centre literally next door. Yes rooms were a bit small. Dubai Mall close by.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Nice”
Reviews.Author: casiogirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I came to Dubai to watch the music concert. Recommended for traveler who need to be close to the city of Dubai, very easy access to the metro, got nice breakfast, clean and nice bedroom and bathroom (shower). Price of the hotel room is reasonable. Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was a nice, clean and friendly atmosphere. the only issue which I was not satified was the Wi-Fi internet was activating on the lobby and we need to pay in the room. nowadays all the chain hotels are offering free internet access in the rooms and this points has to be evaluated. thanks, ozgur

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it. Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the Ibis since my last experience in New Zealand (Queenstown) wasn't something memorable although there was no problem at all with my stay. I just find the Ibis WTC to be surprisingly more avant garde and atypical of an Ibis - higher standards, well maintained and efficient. Again, this is vis-a-vis the Ibis in New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Gitex stop over”
Reviews.Author: larsdominic
Reviews.Content: I have never seen smaller rooms. There is a special combination to open the bathroom door so you can actually get in the bathroom. Clean though. Very practical with no real service. 5 Star prices during exhibitions as which is not surprising.

Reviews.Title: “good value for a short staz”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, staff is very helpful,and it is just 10 minutes away from Dubai mall and 15 from Mall of the Emirates. Room is pretty small though and no possibility to air the room. For a short stay it is absolutely ok

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: aprasetyo
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 6 pm and the room was ready. When offered, I opted for a non-smoking room. The room itself is neat and tidy, clean as well. Bathroom is a bit cramped, but sufficient (soap shampoo available). The TV offers some English channels, so that's good. Unfortunately when I arrived to my non-smoking room, it actually smelled like somebody had been smoking in that room. The bar downstairs was very quiet at around 7 pm (our rendezvous point), but the bartenders said that it would pickup later on. So my buddies and I decided to go ahead and have dinner elsewhere; and then come back later. We finally came back around 11.30 pm... and the place was even more quiet that before; only this time with a DJ. It's ok if you're just looking for a place to crash that is not too far away from the city center (around 3.5km), but entertainment-wise I don't recommend it. Oh and I forgot to mention, the bed mattresses are hard :(

Reviews.Title: “shopping in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ibis trade center is always a convienent hotel.we have been there many times.We are coming from Oman and come for shopping in Dubai..Location is perfect for business and leisure.Maybe a few pillows more in the rooms is advisible.Of course we can call roomservice but why only one extra in the cupboard??? So next time it will be Ibis again.

Reviews.Title: “good value bad booking service end result expensive rooms”
Reviews.Author: rednrosy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic and small. However for that price one cant complain. However I had been charged twice for a two rooms. Despite many enquiries and intitial contacts they just ignore the emails. I spend about 100 days a year in hotels. However this has destroyed my trust. I will now cancel my membership to this hotel. They just ignore

Reviews.Title: “Service and room quality lets down the Ibis brand”
Reviews.Author: ManamaClaire
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Ibis Mall of the Emirates before and found excellent value for money and was hoping this would be the same. I really didn't enjoy my stay. I appreciate that it is a budget option but the service was poor. The only parking available is in a multi storey car park which i was told was directly accessible from the hotel. It turns out this isn't true and it's actually about a 10 minute walk through the adjacent exhibition centre. I asked if there was anyone to help me as I had heavy bags and it was after midnight so I wasn't thrilled about walking around a multi-storey alone but i was told that no help was availabe. After trekking theough the exhibition centre with my bags i got to my room which was almost identical to the room i had in halls of residence when i was a student. The decor, dark wood and especially the carpets, were old fashioned and depressing. As it was 1am I was hoping for room service but the phone in the room didn't work. I had to go back down to reception to ask for a large bottle of water and an orange juice. I was first told to use the vending machine on my floor. I said that I wanted a large bottle and I was told to go into the bar if I wanted these. When I objected on the grounds that I wouldn't have been asked to go to the bar had my phone have been working the staff sighed at me and huffily went to get me something. I think to send a lone woman into a bar at 1am in the morning to buy water was wholly inappropriate and I can guarantee that an Emirati woman would not have been asked to do this. Eventually I got my water but there was no OJ available. The whole scenario was irritating and I really didn't enjoy the stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis World Trade Centre”
Reviews.Author: PeterLim_Singapore
Reviews.Content: No hot water flask for boiling water in the room. Was given 1 upon request. Hotel was well located next to convention hall.

Reviews.Title: “hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thank you for cooperation, but let me give you that bit of advice the room needs to tea and coffee and wateralos intrenet cabel in said room .Iwould like you to stay again in this hotel .I will have the pleasure to visit you

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business or pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: andyw100
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a good central location in Dubai. Inexpensive room rate with good facilities. Plenty of taxis outside all hours of the day. Several coffee shops and restraints all within just a minute walk of the lobby. The lobby is very modern, clean and spacious with plenty of seating and free WIFI (ask at reception for password) or computer access. It also boasts a small shop, outside garden seating / smoking area and access to the bars and eateries. Two elevators give access to all floors including the creche on the first floor. The whole hotel is very clean and the staff are friendly and happy to help. The cleaning staff are also very welcoming and always greet you very politely. The rooms are a moderate size but don't expect anything too large. No hair dryer or tea / coffee making facilities in the rooms. Don't expect anything special from the room window views either. For what you pay you get a very comfy and large bed, very clean rooms, air con and basic bathroom facilities with sink, large mirror, toilet and shower cubicle. Our shower did however badly leak all over the floor and the problem was not fixed even after telling reception. The shower was also very poor and was impossible to keep at a constant good temperature. The reception desk staff are generally helpful and can offer much advise about the local area and also sell tickets for many tours and excursions. Breakfast is served at the CUBO resterant. It's a mix of European continental and a small selection of "hot" food that is slightly more local. The hot selection changes each morning and includes sausage, pancakes, turkey bacon etc. Unfortunately the "hot" food was never even warm and really let a what would of been a good breakfast down. There was still a big choice of pasteries, toast, fruit, meat, yoghurt and much more. By afternoon / evening the CUBO becomes an Italian resteraunt that serves great food and on a thursday evening has an all you can eat buffet with unlimited drinks (Inc. Alcohol) The other bar in the hotel offers live sports on tv with a good selection of drinks (but is more expensive than the other official "hotel bar"), music and a wide menu of food also avaliable. The hotel does not have a pool or gym facilities however guests may use the Novotel's facilities (which is just around the corner about a 4 min walk and the facilities are very good!). There is a charge of 20 AED midweek and 40 AED at UAE weekends (Fri - Sat). Overall the Ibis World Trade Centre is a good hotel and great value for what you get and in a good location within just a moments walk of the Dubai Metro and convention centre. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and a place to rest your head in for the night”
Reviews.Author: possiblebliss
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nothing special - its very much a budget hotel.. cheaper on weekends than during the week because its location is right next to the convention centre. Dont expect anythiing outstanding - its literally just a place to rest your head in for the night.. very minimalistic... the staff at reception were friendly.. if you want to park your car there you need to put a deposit of 500 dhs which youll get back once you check out. i would only recommend it if you need some where cheap to stay..

Reviews.Title: “Good base for seeing Dubai”
Reviews.Author: dominoSouthport
Reviews.Content: Room was small but what I expected for an Ibis. Unfortunately my husband is a smoker so we have to have a smoking room. Because the windows do not open the room cannot be aired. Stunk to high heaven of smoke but it is something I have learned to live with! New metro is very good and the station is a short walk from the hotel. Buy a Noi card to get about. The Burj Khalifa is just down the line but note - you enter through the shopping mall and they have not built a pedestrian entrance! Had to go down the car park ramp. Most bizzare! Dubai is not built for walkers but as the metro was built around the same time as this new tourist attraction you would have thought they would know people would arrive on the metro! There are also coffee shops and cafes within walking distance. There are safe deposit boxes to use behind reception foc. Breakfast was good and the hot drinks machine gave a decent coffee or hot chocolate to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “best for the value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay here again and highly recomend it to freinds and colleague

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel; much better than the equivalent IBIS hotels in other cities of the world. For the first tiem, I was in an IBIS hotel that looked slightely different from all others.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay with great metro transport link”
Reviews.Author: UKHolidaydude
Reviews.Content: Decided on a budget trip to Dubai this time & this hotel delivered everything we needed. Clean & comfortable but rather small room. Good location with quick access onto SZR with its many shops, cafe's & restaurant's. If you are comfortable using the new metro system the WT station is only a couple of minutes walk away. The metro is a superb way to travel around Dubai, frequent & cheap leaving the majority of Dubai's attractions only minutes away. Breakfast in the hotel is a simple affair but sufficient to get you on your way in the morning, we would not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Coffee/tea making facility at the room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel should consider providing either a coffee/tea making facility or putting up beverage vending machine at each floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nimonemo
Reviews.Content: I lived in this hotel for 1 month (company paying when relocating to Dubai). Excellent location next to the metro station plus restaurants and cafes (Cafe Nero and Japengo) next door. Don´t try restaurants in the Ibis as they are an extorsion! Breakfast was nothing special. Rooms too small for a couple but OK for 1 person. Staff at the breakfast room and security guards were very nice and helpful but the ladies at the reception were really bad - they need a customer service course, at least. Internet conexion is extra an very expensive. Swimming pool and helath club can be found at the Novotel next door by paying a fee. Maybe you want to check prices in Novotel before you book Ibis, as apparently sometimes they have good offers and the hotel seems slightly better. Overall, I think IBIS World Trade Centre is the cheapest place you can be in Dubai, bearing in mind location and quality of accomodation. I would recomend this place anybody who wants to see Dubai but does not want to expend a fortune in accomodation. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Louis L
Reviews.Content: Directly connected to the World Trade Center and city metro. Value for $ if you are travelling for Biz. Smokers beware tho, ventilation in the room is not exactly fantastic. Suggest that u go smoke free during your stay rather than choking to death in the room :) Limited dining selection.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Muzza1947
Reviews.Content: After nearly 7 weeks away I considered cancelling this 2 star accommodation but on arrival (3am) I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was far larger than I imagined and although the bathroom was small it was adequate. Best of all it was spotlessly clean. We found the staff attentive to our needs and that included the dining room team. For those looking for a few days stopover this hotel is ideal as one can walk across the road to a vrey large mall.

Reviews.Title: “you can reach everywhere easily”
Reviews.Author: AslisIstanbul
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located in the business district and in world trade center, and compared to quality vs price it is really outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Great Value,”
Reviews.Author: WontonSoup
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Dubai, we chose the Ibis because of the location and price. We thought we are not going to stay in the hotel but to sleep. On first impression the hotel was nice, the rooms were just on the small side but very clean, we had fresh towels and the room was cleaned daily. The staff was very helpful in explaining excursions and places to visit in Dubai even if the English was not great. The breakfast buffet had a nice choice of European selection, fresh fruits and cold meats. Overall the impression is if you are heading for Dubai for a short trip then Ibis is good and cheaper choice.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, great location”
Reviews.Author: r88my
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel strikes a nice balance between price/service. Room had air con and was clean and quiet. The main reason we stayed here was for the location, Sheikh Zayed Rd is a good central point in Dubai you will never run into any problems getting a taxi. There are an abundance of eateries within walking distance too. If you are looking for a cheap place to stay, this could be it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: kalp1000
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay with family. But have no other facility like Gym, pool and other indoor games. We book through travel agent and we paid 360AED. but if you book directly through their website it will be cheap and you can book in 290AED. Cost of laundry and for food is too much expensive. Even washing a te-shirt can cause you 20AED. Snack is around 55AED per person. Internet charges are also too high 25AED. If you are with family and then this hotel is good as in other some hotels they have bar, and bar danchers may be not suitable for you. If you are going with big family then you book Apartment hotels..You can book Floora park hotel apratment and lotus family apartments this all are good to stay with family. They are providing fridge, TV, all full furnished kitchen so you can cook your snack and wash cloths at free of cost and the total trip will be very cheap

Reviews.Title: “if all hotels were like Ibis..?”
Reviews.Author: STynetraveller
Reviews.Content: what a stylish place this is! We needed a place to crash after arriving early from India. We were able to check in immediately (about 9a.m.) and I was in the bed within 10 minutes and it was well comfy. Had never been to Dubai before - took the stop-over option from Emirates. In short, Dubai is a bit tough to do on a budget as its all about the swank. The world trade centre is not really near anything else so we moved on to another Ibis next to the Mall of the Emirates the next morning. Although the price is as low as you could wish for, the public areas and rooms are very cool and modern and the staff could not have been friendlier/more helpful. T'internet is pricey but hey-ho.

Reviews.Title: “Basic price, Basic service”
Reviews.Author: culturevulture80
Reviews.Content: Our arrival set a negative tone that we struggled to forget. The website had stated that the hotel had carparking but when we got there this turned out to be incorrect. No car park, no valet service. There was a multi storey near by but this would have costed us more than the room itself!. The reception staff were lacking in knowledge and language skills. They kept on saying ' the hotel has no parking' to whatever car based question I posed, but were unable to offer any suggestions on how to solve this problem. Eventually we got to speak to someone more knowledgable who directed us to some free parking. It is worth saying that the directions were incorrect and that without sat-nav we would have been totally screwed. The parking was free but 10 minutes walk in blistering heat back to the hotel. From the moment we first arrived to actually getting to the room this whole debacle had taken an hour! The lack of local knowledge and language skills impacted us not long after. We asked if the metro was open and were told yes. We then asked if there was a station nearby and were told yes. We then asked for directions. The directions were poor and made no mention of there being no pavement and a large highway in the way that was virtually imposible to cross. When we got close to the station it was nowhere near being finished with large scale construction taking place. We could not believe that they had directed us to a closed metro station and were livid after struggling to get there in the heat. The reality is that this is a cheap hotel with nicer rooms than you could probably get elsewhere for the price. Yes the rooms are tiny but they were clean and everything worked. The location will be excellent once the metro is fully working as the WTC will have a station and even until then is central between old Dubai and new. I'm sure we would have loved our stay had we not have had the unfortunate start. If you remind yourself that you are paying a very basic price then you'll probably be pleasently surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, but for a reason”
Reviews.Author: ScheffCM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis WTC in Dubai for four nights in October 2009. Arriving late (or early) at about 4AM in the morning, reception staff was able to welcome me by name, as there were basically no other guests arriving or around in the lobby. I visited Dubai mainly for sightseeing and to check, whether a longer second trip with friends would be worthwhile. LOCATION The hotel forms part of the convention centre and allows for direct access to the centre through the lobby. Sheikh Zayed Road stretches out behind a block of apartments (World Trade Centre Apartments, if you go to the front of the apartments, there is a small supermarket). The World Trade Centre Metro station will be within walking distance of the hotel once it is opened to the public. Right now, the Financial Centre station is the nearest operational one. Being somebody who rather walks some minutes instead of taking public transport or taxis, I had to change this behaviour in Dubai, as pedestrians seem not to be part of road planning. Speaking of taxis, there are not always taxis waiting outside the hotel, so one might bear that in mind. I did write down some costs for taxi rides (might vary, but for some reference): Airport (terminal 1) - Ibis: 37AED Ibis - Bur Dubai near Ministry of Finance: 25AED Ibis - The Address hotel (near Burj Dubai, Dubai Mall): 15AED Ibis - Emirates Towers: 10AED (minimum fare) Ibis - Jumeirah Beach Hotel: 37AED Financial Centre Metro station - trade centre (2mins from hotel): 10AED (minimum fare) HOTEL / ROOMS The hotel looks quite new from the outside. However, the interior and the romms show some use and abuse. As mentioned above, staff was very friendly and helpful (especially at the reception). I had breakfast at the hotel once (55AED, buffett style), which I found to be enough for my eating habits. The standard food was avalable: scrambled eggs, sausages, choice of bread, rolls and toast, some pastries, cereals, joghurts and fruit. The drink section featured apple and orange juice, milk, choice of tea and choice of coffee-based beverages. The breakfast area is not too large and might get a bit crowded at some times. There was also a limited "early bird" breakfast available in the lobby for 25AED. I can't comment on the restaurant, as I did eat out in the evenings. A hint regarding water: There is a machine selling bottles (0,5l) of cold still water for only 1AED (coins required!) on every floor. The room (637 in my case) was large enough for one person, but seemed to be a regular double room for single use. Please refer to the pictures for more details on the general look. The regular TV set (I spotted Arabic, English, French and German channels) and telephone were all there, but e.g. no hairdryer or safe. The bathroom was quite small and showed some signs of usage. Towels were provided of course, but not regularly changed during my stay, even with one towel being really dirty upon arrival. This also was the major flaw of the hotel during my stay: the bathroom was not properly cleaned and the shower head had to be used quite carefully to not fully destroy its mount. Additionally, the shower basin did leak, requiring at least one towel on the floor to prevent flooding. VERDICT All in all my stay at the Ibis WTC was not too bad considering the rate (399AED/night) and the fact that I did only stay in my room to sleep and shower. However, given the flaws regarding that last part, I might look for another hotel for my next stay in Dubai, probably one being located near Old Town / Burj Dubai for expanded dining opportunities. Travellers who have to stay within a tight budget might find the Ibis to suit their needs, if not expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss - there are much better options in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: ms109238
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and easy to navigate. The rooms are small, and the bathroom is quite cramped, but usable. I found the beds to be moderately uncomfortable. My biggest gripe with this hotel is the service. While I wouldn't expect over the top service for a hotel in this price range, the front desk staff are rude and unhelpful, and appeared annoyed when asked the most benign questions. Unfortunately this held true for all four desk clerks with whom I interacted. In my student days I also worked as a hotel desk clerk, and I know what a challenge the job can be, but this was unacceptable. When asked (on a Friday) where a certain item might be purchased, we were advised to go to shops in a specific area of Dubai - however no mention was made that all shops are closed on Fridays - we took a cab there only to find that nothing would be open for 2 days. When asked about exchanging money, we were given misinformation and advised to utilize the hotel exchange at poorer rates. And when our travel plans were disrupted and we found ourselves needing to stay an extra day, our rate suddenly went up significantly. As this is their perogative and we didn't wish to traipse around locating additional lodging, we paid it, but it is poor customer service. And the breakfast originally included in our stay suddenly was no longer available. Internet service is about $30 USD for 24 hours and is relatively slow (although not the worst that we have run into in hotels in this region). The location is convenient if you have meetings at the World Trade Center, but otherwise the hotel is not particularly well located for a visitor - it is far from any amenities, leaving you at the mercy of the hotel restaurant (mediocre at best) and what little is offered in the hotel gift shop. If you are traveling for business and it's location suits you, then it is clean and inexpensive, and likely adequate. If you are traveling as a tourist, I would recommend finding something located in Deira for local atmosphere and convenience to the Souks and areas of Bur Dubai, or else somewhere along the coast for a more resort-feel. We stayed in another hotel in Deira for several days previously and found that to be much more convenient in location, as well as more service-oriented. Given the number of hotels in this town, I would advise anyone considering this hotel to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Economical Hotel for Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: arabhammerhead
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 480 Dh. Convenient location, although it is quite annoying when there are conferences you cannot catch taxis from the hotel entrance and have to be shuttled to a taxi stand. The Chianti bar in the lobby is ok and the pasta bar night is quite pleasant. The room is compact, economical, and reasonably clean. The internet is priced at 100 Dh for 24 hours - a rip off but standard for Dubai. Not too far from Bur Dubai and other entertainment districts in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: Alleycat1820
Reviews.Content: I stayed here solo on vacation, thought the location was decent - Sheik Zayed Rd. Perfect if you are attending a convention as the centre is connected to the hotel. Staff were very helpful and friendly, they gave me a huge corner room. The room itself was clean, big bed, bathroom was a tad small and the shower leaked on to the floor. The lobby was nice, they offered pastries and tea/coffee every morning there. The main restaurant had a great complimentary breakfast buffet - lots of very good food to choose from. Shuttle service to and from the malls and beach are a great free service, take advantage of it and save on cab fares. And a little hint to those complaining about the lack of internet service: There are a number of free kiosks in the convention centre adjacent to the Ibis. I'd also recommend using the concierge to book excursions - the desert safari was awesome! If this hotel was on the beach it would be perfect. It is a business class hotel and not as luxurious as some of the others in Dubai, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Functional & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: sourabhedwankar
Reviews.Content: Location : Hotel is close to the airport . The taxi charged us AED 44. Depending on tariff, the hotel gives u free drop & pick up from the airport. The hotel gives u free Bus service ( 5 trips a day) to Jumerah, Mall of Emirates & one more mall. This saves transportation cost. Being a business area, there are no shops for groceries, toiletories, snacks or cold drinks. No restaurants except ones in the hotels. There is no light life in this area. Description : The hotel is located next to the WTC. Its very useful for conferences in WTC. We paid Rs.11500 ~ AED 884 ( 2 people 4D/3N with breakfast) during the July heat. The lobby is good. There is minimal service given. You carry own luggage to the rooms. Drinking water can be bought thru a dispenser on each floor. You can collect ice from the bar for free. Non veg breakfast is good. There is minimal choice for vegetarians. The swimming pool is chargeable & is shared with the adjoining hotel. Could not find the gym but it is also shared. The safe box is at the lobby. The rooms are small , compact & functional. The TV channels cater to the European customer & not much choice for Asians. The hotel staff helped us with recommending places & gave accesories like electric adapters for our chargers. ( They use the square sockets) Taxis keep plying around the area but its better to have a contact / book a taxi in advance & not depend on one to just pass by. Recommended for Business Traveller. Not for Leisure trips or people who want to walk in the surroundings or shop for small items. Car or transportis absolutely essential

Reviews.Title: “Not the same hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy365
Reviews.Content: Still a clean hotel for around $100 per night. Now the downside, NO more free shuttle to and from the airport. "Yes" as the front desk clerk stated "we are internet accessible" of course at the cost of $30 per night. $30 per night for internet!!! Their reasonable breakfast (which was good) $15. I have traveled to some modern cities and have not paid that for a nice room with WIFI included. Second time at the Ibis and will probably be the last.

Reviews.Title: “great value, clean, well located and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: tell-it-as-it-is47
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights in this hotel and was very pleased. The price was great for Dubai (£60 including breakfast). The room was big enough and though the bathroom was small it was big enough. The room was cleaned very well indeed. The staff were very friendly. The manager on the reception desk (my guess was he is Egyptian) was really nice. He was always smiling and joking and very helpful. The breakfast was really good though on some mornings it was really busy. The rooms were really well insulated. No noise from the corridor, or from the adjacent rooms. This makes a really refreshing change from many hotels I have stayed at. It is well located. Yes, the rooms are not huge but they are more fine. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; great value”
Reviews.Author: Tarun71
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying here as the hotel was very well located, had good restaurants and had very good service. While it was a very functional hotel, I'd recommend it for family stay also purely because of the cleanliness and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very worn”
Reviews.Author: Worldglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading Tripadvisor and it was cheap but not so cheerful. Excellent location, pleasant reception area and staff but didn't even take luggage into the room. It was a medium size room (room to walk around the bed) but it was so worn and shabby with a tiny bathroom. The furniture was dark wood and heavily knocked about and a bed with very flat pillows . It looked clean but we didn't stay long enough to look too closely and moved to the sister hotel the Novotel which the IBIS arranged for us. They were very understanding and the transition went very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SK812
Reviews.Content: The Ibis World Trade Centre is a disgrace to the Accor brand. The lack of customer service was shocking. I will never stay in another Ibis property because of the treatment I recieved at the Ibis World Trade Centre - do yourself a favour and book somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: shantsr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the New Year period. Excellent value for money. I originally booked with an Accor membership rate which was the lowest I could find. On arrival, we noticed a board outside offering the rate of the day, which was lower than our booked rate. On request, they were happy to give us the lower rate. The public areas of the hotel, the café/bar and the restaurant are all very stylish and I would rate these at a 4 star level. The bedrooms were also fitted out with the same standards. The only issues we had were that the room was very small (which we knew going in) and the TV reception was poor. Also our shower cubicle leaked but was promptly attended to. Standards of service was high and cleanliness could not be faulted. Only issues we had with location (again we knew of this) were the lack of restaurants within walking distance. There are no porters at this hotel. The tour desk was very helpful and at the time of our stay, taxis were easy to get. Overall, a very enjoyable experience and definitely recommended as a value for money stay in an overpriced market.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lacks few important services”
Reviews.Author: dabbot
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at Ibis and my first impression about the hotel was really good. Rooms are really neat & modern. I got good deal because I booked the hotel when there was no conference/event happening in adjoining convention center because thats the time when prices go up by almost 70%. I paid around 450 dh per night which I believe was very good value for money considering what other 3 star hotels were offering. They have 1 italian restaurant plus 24 hour bar. Here is the summary: Good Points: 1. Very good location - starting of shiekh zayed road so you get good view of skyscrapers 2. Free shuttle from & to the airport every hour - saves money 3. Free shuttle service to 3 malls & jumeira beach 4. Adjoining convention center - very good for business travellers participating in any event or exhibition there Bad Points: 1. No room service - you have to pick up everything from the lobby 2. No newspaper in the room - basic requirement for a business hotel 3. Poor taxi service in front of the hotel 4. Very small toilet but it is very neat & modern All said & done, it was still a good stay for us and we dont mind there going again provided we get the same deal we got this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussietrekker
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Ibis World Trade Centre in August 2008. The hotel is great value for the price with clean linin, comfortable rooms and very friendly service with a smile. It was the one place in Dubai where as a Western women, I was not stared at as though I was a leper. A great find and somewhere I would recommend and return to if I ever go back to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: tired-bus-raveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent for a business stay, - on the same site as the exhibition centre. Clean sheets on the bed each day, reliable internet connection. The bar service is second to none Highly recommended for the price

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Annie42Fife
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was really nice and clean, bedding and sheets were changed every day!!!! The rooms were compact but ideal for a short stay. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The only downfall was it would have been nice to have Tea and Coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: timborules84
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Novotel before, I thought the Ibis with its international reputation would be also good. Wrong. Firstly, it is not that much cheaper (if at all) than the Novotel. The main problems are that there is no room service, very slow laundry service, poor internet connection and the rooms are like student accommodation with awful bathrooms (just shower). Most annoyingly, there are no bell boys as this is not "ibis policy" despite the fact of very affordable labour in Dubai and that many staff who look like bell boys, stand around doing nothing. One plus point - they serve strongbow.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great.”
Reviews.Author: polaatx
Reviews.Content: I booked at $126/night at ibis.com website. I decided to stay another night. They raised priced to $153, even though it was still $126 on online and simply denied that was the case. "The room rate fluctuates everyday," front desk person says, but not the case online at all. My experience with other hotels is that they continue to honor the online price when you decide to stay longer. Not here. No parking. There's paid, hourly parking nearby. There's a tiny free lot next to the building but always full. Internet is $22 a day and of course they don't bother to tell you that free wireless access streams in from World Trade Center next door. Oh, you forgot to bring your laptop? No problem. there are computers you can use, at $22 AN HOUR! (I exchanging the rate at the fixed rate of 3.67 dhs per USD) Breakfast, just an ordinary buffet, $18. They even charge for using the pool at Novotel next door. My impression of IBIS hotels in Europe (mostly Germany) was that they weren't so greedy, trying to pile up charges every which way they can. I remember free laptop connected to internet in every IBIS in Germany. No such thing here. Attitude at front desk: take it or leave it. We really don't give a hoot what you think, which I think is understandable because they have steady stream of convention goers at the Trade Center. Rooms, old and rundown, and tiny. Showerhead loose and kept swiveling back to the side. Sink cloggs. Wood moldings chipped. Carpet old. Not within walking distance of anywhere, such as supermarkets and convenience stores. They have you captive here and forced to buy everything from them at high prices. I guess ideal as far as price for someone attending the Trade Center, but if you need to work on the Internet in your room and eat in the hotel all the time, plan to spend a lot more than just the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharc84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night on our return to Dubai from Muscat in Oman. There is no comparision between this hotel and this Arabian Courtyard which we stayed in first. The room is small and basic but perfectly functionable. There is an Italian restaurant in the hotel where we had our lunch and I have to say that it was delicious. We had the buffet breakfast which was extra to the €100 we paid for the room. Typical buffet but nice and filling. We were able to leave our luggage in the secure left luggage room for the whole day which was a great bonus and there was also a complimentary shuttle bus to the airport which saved us another few dirhams – liked these services. As an affordable hotel in Dubai it is great – you get what you pay for really. You are located in Sheik Zayed Road so near the malls and Jumeriah beach. We stayed in the Arabian Courtyard for approx €140 so for the extra €40 (which actually included breakfast) I think it is worth paying that little bit extra due to the superiority of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: KatyGreenbank
Reviews.Content: Dubai is full of very expensive, very luxurious hotels but if you need a clean, modern, inexpensive place to stay, Ibis is an excellent choice. There seems to be a big gulf between the vast majority of hotels charging a lot of money per night and so-called "budget" hotels so Ibis made a wise choice building one here! But this isn't a budget hotel in the traditional sense - it's a solid 3* in my opinion with well-equipped rooms, a fashionable Phillipe Stark reception area, internet facilities, knowledgeable concierge, decent restaurant and a very good breakfast that was included in our £75 room charge. It's part of the World Trade Centre complex and is equidistant between Jumeirah and Deira. Taxis are plentiful and cheap. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: viajes.papi
Reviews.Content: It is an Ibis above average Ibis standards. The hall is huge. There is a concierge which will help with information on the city, travel bokings & shuttle timetables. There is a free shuttle to the airport & several shopping malls, very useful, just ask for the timetable beforehand, or as you arrive at termial 1 look for the man with the Accorhotel (novotel & ibis) sign. The rooms aren't that small, maybe they are to dubai standards, but not to european. It is not the cleanest I've been to but it's fine. Excellent service providing hairdryer & plug adaptor. The location is very convenient, even if you don't go to the trade centre, there are a couple of cafes, there's a pharmacy and ATMs, and some internet kiosks. No luxury spa, but you may use the swimming pool at the Novotel for a charge. Breakfast we didn't take, quite expensive for dubai. For the price, get a cab and go to Bastikaya for a true arabain breakfast experience. The location is great to aviod rush hour traffic jams, though it may take a while to get a cab sometimes. Beware of taxis in dubai, they'll take you around with the only purpose of making the trip longer, as they charge on a gps-distance-measure basis, so if you're stuck in a traffic jam, the meter doesn't move. The more you move, the more they charge. Excellent choice, basic but fine hotel, good price (for dubai) efficient service. Definitely to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short business stay”
Reviews.Author: peperone
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights for an international exhibition in World Trade Center of Dubai. It's just 2 minutes walking distance from the exhibition hall and it's the best way preventing from rush hour traffic jam in Dubai. The hotel was clean but the rooms were so simple and a little small. Internet connection was around 30 USD for 24 hours and speed is average. The reception staff was not so kind but still helpful. The breakfast were good but they don't have so much alternatives to choose. The nightly cost of the hotel is reasonable compare with other hotels in Dubai. Also, they have free bus service to three different shopping malls three times in a day. In the last day of my stay, i attended a safari tour by 70 USD per person and it was amazing. It includes dessert 4x4 tour, barbecue dinner and other entertainments. I strongly recommend this hotel for exhibition visitors in world trade center.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ibis I´ve stayed at”
Reviews.Author: zolagola
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there in May 2007 already, I decided to come back in October and rightly so. This time, the free airport-pickup was quicker than last time, staff as friendly and helpful as I was used to. Organising trips, offering to keep baggage overnight in the baggage room whilst you are on tour -all no problem. Rooms are clean, with big and comfy beds, all quite spacious given that this hotel ranks at the lower end of Dubai´s hotel rates. I would always stay there again and can only recommend this place - that is if you are looking for a "normal" hotel in Dubai and not one trying to compete with the Burj.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: RubyRubySydney
Reviews.Content: For the traveller who would prefer to get out of their hotel room and explore a city, the Ibis is perfect. The price is good value, the rooms are clean and well-appointed and the breakfast is fine. Taxis in Dubai are dirt-cheap so we loved the Ibis as more of our money was spent out and about eating, drinking, shopping, etc. It was simply a clean, safe place to sleep and re-fuel, and for that is was perfect. Tip: Hunt around online for better prices than booking directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Ibis was great!”
Reviews.Author: Mel1707
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great from the very beginning. As we emerged from the airport there was a free shuttle bus taking you to the hotel. The rooms were small, but very clean and modern. The buffet breakfast was about 15AUD and was very good. The hotel also had a free shuttle bus to all the main shopping centres and some tourist attractions.Overall, I would most def stay here again. I think we paid about 120AUD a night booked on Expedia. We were very happy with the Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “very simple”
Reviews.Author: Marsio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next Sheikh Zayed Road if you are biz traveller its good location. It is very simple accomodation especially the bathroom is soo small it needs re-decorating and proper cleaning. I didn't like the bed too much. Price if there's no exhibition next door is usually pretty good for Dubai prices can go down to 325 aed in summer even less. If u need just 2 nights and will be most of the time out it is ok budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Ibis”
Reviews.Author: Raccoonteur
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for two days at the Ibis Trade Centre Hotel in Dubai. It was very disappointing. It started from our arrival by car. Ibis has a small lot next door that can fit approximately 10 cars (and the hotel has more than 200 rooms!). There is no valet service. If the small lot is full, you must park a few minutes down the road and pay an hourly rate as well. The hotel will not validate that parking. After we parked, we were helped by an indifferent attendant at the check-in desk. At check-out, it was the same treatment. Also know that this hotel is quite remote in a convention center area. You will have to drive or take a taxi for any needs. The only good point is that the rate at 475 Dhs per night is very reaosnable by Dubai standards, and your room will probably be clean, safe if not extremely basic.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: AussiesSydney
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had an amazing 3 weeks in Dubai. We manage to shop till I dropped but also enjoyed the culture of this city. This is an ideal place to access the best shopping and sites ie. Mall of the Emirates, Mercato Mall, Ibn Battuta Mall, Burjamen Centre, Wafi City, Burj Al Arab, Wild Wadi, Souk Madinat, Gold & Spice Souk, Diera City Centre, Bur Dubai Souk, Dubai Museum, Bastakia Quarters, Hindi Lane, Grand Mosque. The hotel is placed between Bur Dubai and Diera districts. The room is very clean but small. Who cares! You will be out on the town most of the time. My tip utilise the free shuttle bus to and from the airport and shopping malls. If you are going to Ibn Battuta Mall or Burj Al Arab catch the free Ibis shuttle bus to Mall of the Emirates then catch a taxi. We also stayed at the Sheraton Dubai Creek which was incredible but the next time I come back to Dubai my wife & I will come to this hotel. You can't beat the best location and VALUE FOR MONEY between Bur Dubai & Diera!!!!! Regards Two Aussie Travellers

Reviews.Title: “Good for Bussiness only”
Reviews.Author: BadrAlSaif
Reviews.Content: I read all reviews about this hotel and I fell in love with it but when I stayed in the hotel the idea of it had changed. Like: 1- Free ride to the Airport, and this is what I like the most. 2- Close to the World Trade Center (by walking). 3- Laundry and maintenace service are EXCELLENT. 4- Good price. Dislike: 1- Room is not small but TINY. 2- Chair and desk are not so good. 3- Guest must carry his/her bags to the room, nobody will carry those for you and won't anyone from staff will help you. I traveled around and stayed at 3* hotels but staff carried my bags. I don't know what is wrong with this hotel. 4- Nothing close by, guest can' t go by walking and must take a taxi all the time. (for me I prefer to walk most of the time) 5- no swimming pool nor business center. For me I will rate Ibis World Trade Center as (0.5*-1*) , what do you think?

Reviews.Title: “great value, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: segenet
Reviews.Content: great for a short stay, very good value compared to other hotels for the same price in Dubai. Very clean and modern although room was quite small. keep in mind this is a business hotel therefore there is no room service or other hotel amenities but there is a great breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: np8by
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from the IBIS and would say that this is a 3* hotel. The room were modern and clean but very small. The reception area was very nice. Good central hotel and ideal for 1st time visitors to see Dubai. We had no problems getting taxi either

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: StevieG489
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel using lastminute dot com for 5 days between 12-17 May 2007. Probably the cheapest you can get for this part of town and it is in a more favourable than Deira, particulalry if you are likely to spend more time in the Jumerirah beach resorts. A bus service collects from the airport hourly. However, I did not use it because a friend picked me up. It is worthwhile using because taxi journeys from the airport carry a special surcharge (20Dhs = £3). Journey time is about 10-15 minutes depending on traffic. Nice clean lobby area at the hotel with sofas and coffee tables for loafing around. Three internet terminals are available but not many people use it, probably because of the cost (was 24Dhs=£3.50 for 20 minutes or 72Dhs=£10 for 1 hour). Not sure what the price was for wireless. Room was clean though starting to get a bit scuffy. Shower leaked a bit but it wasn't much of a problem. Air conditioning very effective. The only disappointments were the lack of tea/coffee making facilities and the lack of English TV channels (a news channel sould have been nice). There's a small bar which is fairly busy and open 24-7. I only used it once and the prices seemed reasonable. Snacks are ordered here (sandwiches/fries etc). The Italian restaurant next door closes at midnight and I'm told it is reasonably good. A cafe is located a short walk inside the adjacnt convention centre and serves coffees and pre-prepared sandwiches and cakes etc.. There's a small shop with post cards, maps, books, magazines. I bought a map there which was quite expensive. Breakfast in the hotel is buffet style and nothing spectacular. A choice of three cereals (cornflakes, museli or all bran), selection of yoghurts, fresh fruit salad, croissants, white and brown bread toast, fresh orange and apple juice, tea and coffee, cold meats and cheeses....The cooked breakfast didn't look that appetising and consisted of potato cakes/hash browns, beef bacon, sausages, beans and scrambled or fryed egg. The sausages looked like the economy ones out of Asda (Wall Mart)!!! Overall I was fairly happy with it and all the cutlery was clean. Coffee tasted quite nice too.. The Novotel is a 5 minute walk through the exibition centre and I'm told you can use their facilities at cost. Taxis are very frequent and it costs an average of 21Dhs=£3 to get to most of the large shopping centres. There are several free bus services but the're not always that frequent so I took taxis for convenience, particulalry when returning to the hotel. Note that a Taxi to Wild Wadi Water Park (next to Jumeira Beach Hotel) is around 35Dhs= £5. Overall I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who wants the guarrantee of a quiet hotel, close to all the major shopping centres but at a modest price. The only downside besides the ones already mentioned is that there are no local shops where you can pick up water, snacks, or drinks after midnight. You have to make do with the bar food and drinks which obviously are going to cost more.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt even get a reservation”
Reviews.Author: tuamfamily
Reviews.Content: I have done the research and loved the reviews of this hotel. Couldnt get any information from the website for current rates or availability so i called and was transfered between reception and reservations 3 times before someone was able to actually speak to me. I was told i couldnt get into any of the rooms as my husband and i have one set of 3 yr old twins, and they only have one queen size bed per room. although they ran through the 'formalities of yes ma'm no ma'm' i did think they werent too interested if they gained a customer or not.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: jonjertal
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Ibis in two rooms for 2 nights. The hotel is in a good location, away from the hussle but within easy reach to everywhere by taxi, which is by the way a very cheap way of getting around in Dubai. The rooms were very clean and the staff very polite and helpful. They have a free shuttle bus running every hour to/from the airport, as well as shuttle service to other tourist destinations. Only minus was the cost of using the internet at the foyer, AUD$8 per 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: birdette
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Novotel Dubai which is IbIs’s sister hotel few times already, but this was the first time I stayed at Ibis. Novotel and Ibis are close to the Trade Center and are next door to each other. Dubai is an expensive city so this is the cheapest yet decent hotel you can get for the price. Just to give you an idea we paid almost 500 Dhs which is about $140 USD which included breakfast. This was a corporate rate, otherwise it would have been about 600. It’s quite a lot for a hotel such as Ibis but not much for a hotel in Dubai. Here are some points to help you decide if you would like to stay here. If you are on a budget this might be your best bet, I wouldn’t recommend any other cheap hotels based on what I’ve heard: • Rooms are clean but VERY small • Not the best pillows or mattress • No mini-bar, coffee maker and NO hairdryer in the rooms •NO PARKING, which was insane and we had to pay an additional 60 Dhs/night for parking •Not the friendliest and most efficient staff but again you are UAE and can’t ask for more. •VERY SMALL SHOWER, no BATH TUB •Only one restaurant which has a buffet so if you just want a light meal, you have to go out. We walked to Novotel and had a nice dinner at Lotus. Would I stay there again? probably not. I would rather pay a little extra and stay at Novotel next door which has a nice bar, few restaurants, parking, swimming pool and a proper shower and mini bar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, halfway between old and new cities”
Reviews.Author: willsmithorg
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6am with room only booked for the next night. Helpful staff let us put our luggage in secure storage while we looked around the city. We returned at 10am and our room was ready (theoretically checkin is 12noon). Room was good although no view to speak of. Staff were helpful throughout our visit, and do note there are free shuttle buses to the 3 biggest malls (approx every 2 hours) as well as hourly shuttle buses to *and from* the airport. Ibis is about 10 minutes' taxi from the old city and the creek. Equally it's about 10 minutes' taxi from the new city, sites like the Burj Al Arab hotel and the "Mall of the Emirates" which contains Ski Dubai. All these timings are weekend timings, apparently things slow down a lot during weekday rush hours. You can also walk to the "avenue" of incredibly high rise buildings, takes about 10 minutes although they are rather soulless when you get there. Joggers can happily jog around the world trade centre block (Ibis, conference centre, Novotel) - we did, it takes about 15 minutes. However, there's not much else in the area unless you take a taxi; one passes the front door every couple of minutes. At £50 our room was good value. However, as budget travellers / backpackers, we may be tempted to stay in Bur Dubai (neer the creek) next time for closer proximity to the incredibly cheap Indian food in that area, and the souks. Business travellers or people with a reasonable budget will find it excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very clean, brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: KDUR123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, like a travel lodge but loads nicer. Small rooms, but v clean, comfy bed too! Hotel has a small but smart bar, a huge reception, great staff, lovely breakfast area, good food,inc in the price, only paid £75 a night in dec 2006 Only £3 to get into town, v frequent taxis. This doesnt have a pool, this is just a place to stay at night rather than stay during the day. Very impressed, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Silvertimtim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Dubai Rugby7's. Perfect location for all Dubai has to offer. Small rooms but adequate and clean. Bar and restaurant downstairs are ok. Bar could do with being bigger. Taxis are always available and waiting outside the hotel. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised by This One!”
Reviews.Author: magnoona
Reviews.Content: I arrived about 7.30am in the morning after a 14 hour flight from Australia and was informed that check-in was 2pm, but that they would do their best to get me in earlier. I was happy to accept this and expected to have to go out feeling rather the worse for wear. At approximately 8.30am I was informed I could take my room and I was able to have a good rest before hitting the sights. I was not charged extra and I was extremely grateful that they did this, although no doubt they were keen to remove the tired-looking bedraggled traveler reclining sleepily in their foyer! I found the staff exceptionally friendly, helpful and polite, except for one snooty one who thankfully I had very little to do with. I was however quite perplexed by the fact that they did not advertise anywhere that they offer a free coach service to a number of Dubai malls and the beach area. The cabs in Dubai are inexpensive, but still, it is more convenient to take a coach from your hotel rather than try and flag down a cab in the heat. The Ibis is not far – but still a decent cab ride – from the main attractions. The breakfast was excellent and I popped into the lovely Cubo bar for drinks and snacks one afternoon. The rooms are basic but very clean. I’ve definitely had smaller. As this hotel is at the lower cost end (but still expensive for Australians staying there) I think it offers excellent accommodation and a high quality of service. I stayed there for two nights, transiting to Morocco, but maybe if you are looking for something more comfortable (there is no ‘view’ to speak of and the basicness of the room might get to you after a while) you could go elsewhere but it would cost you an arm and a leg. I was a woman travelling alone and felt very safe and looked after here. The airport pick ups and dropoffs were very efficient also.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gokiwi
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here in early October during Ramadan. Although rooms are small they are very comfortable and modern. Very quiet, good restaurants attached and able to use Novotel facilities. Good location and excellent shuttle bus service to malls, beach etc. Staff friendly and helpful.
